sen.j: 中根 元圭（なかね げんけい、寛文2年（1662年） - 享保18年9月2日 (旧暦)（1733年10月9日））は、江戸時代中期の和算家、天文家、である。
sen.e: Genkei NAKANE (中根 元圭, 1662 - October 9, 1733) was a wasanka (mathematician) and tenmonka (astronomer) in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.e: He was originally a disciple of Yoshizane TANAKA, and from an early age he wrote books such as "Shinsenkorekibinran" (新撰古暦便覧), "Sanseizokukai" (三正俗解), "Jujirekizukaihakki" (授時暦図解発揮), and so on.

sen.j: 享保6年（1721年）（享保2年（1717年）説もある）、建部賢弘の推薦で江戸に招かれ、天文書などの有用な書に限り洋書の輸入を認めるよう徳川吉宗に進言した。
sen.e: In 1721 (or 1717 in another opinion), he was invited to Edo on the recommendation of Katahiro TAKEBE, and suggested to Yoshimune TOKUGAWA that he allow people to import only the useful foreign books such as books on astronomy.

sen.e: In1726, he was ordered to convert into the Japanese-style reading and translate "Rekisanzensho" (暦算全書), and in 1733, when he was 72 years old, he completed the task, but he died in the same year.
